info.name: Reading List Manager API
info.description: This is the root level for this API testing workspace, containing all collections related to the Reading List Manager API. It is organized by resources such as Books, Ratings, Notes, and Favorites, and the tests are divided into Positive and Negative Tests.

item.name: Books

exec: pm.test("Books list is not empty", function () {
pm.test("Each book contains required fields", function () {

request.description: Tests the GET /books endpoint to retrieve a list of all books in the system. The test checks if the response returns a status code of 200 and verifies the structure of the returned data.

exec: pm.test("Response body contains book details", function () {

request.description: Tests the GET /books/{id} endpoint to retrieve a specific book by its ID. This test validates that the response status code is 200 and that the correct book data is returned.

exec: pm.expect(jsonData.title).to.eql("I Will Teach You to Be Rich");

body.raw:
{
    "title": "I Will Teach You to Be Rich",
    "author": "Ramit Sethi",
    "genre": "Finance",
    "publication_year": 2009,
    "status_reading": "not_started"
}

request.description: Tests the POST /books endpoint to create a new book. This test checks if the API returns a 201 status code upon successful creation and that the book's details are stored correctly.
Tests the PUT /books/{id} endpoint to update an existing book's details. This test ensures the book's data is updated correctly and that the correct status code (200) is returned.
Tests the DELETE /books/{id} endpoint to delete a book by its ID. The test verifies that the book is deleted and the correct status code (200) is returned.

exec: pm.test("Response is in JSON format", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /books endpoint with missing required fields in the request body. This ensures the API returns a 400 status code and an appropriate error message.

request.description: Tests the POST /books endpoint with data in an incorrect format (e.g., missing fields, incorrect data types). This ensures the API returns a 400 status code indicating bad input.

request.description: Tests the PUT /books/{id} endpoint with missing required fields. This ensures the API responds with a 404 status code indicating the book was not found.

item.description: This collection is dedicated to testing the API endpoints for managing books. It includes requests to create, read, update, and delete books, along with testing various edge cases and invalid inputs.

item.name: Ratings

request.description: Tests the POST /ratings endpoint to add a new rating for a book. The test ensures that the rating is created successfully and returns a 201 status code.

exec: pm.test("Correct rating data is returned", function () {

request.description: Tests the GET /ratings/{id} endpoint to retrieve a rating by its ID. This test ensures that the rating is correctly fetched and that the response status code is 200.

exec: pm.test("Correct response data after update", function () {

request.description: Tests the PUT /ratings/{id} endpoint to update an existing rating. The test verifies that the rating is updated correctly and the API responds with a 200 status code.
Tests the DELETE /ratings/{id} endpoint to delete a rating by its ID. The test ensures the rating is deleted successfully and the status code 200 is returned.

item.name: Add Rating without Missing Required Fields

exec: pm.test("Error message for missing rating", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /ratings endpoint by sending a request with missing required fields (e.g., rating value). The test ensures the API returns a 400 status code with an appropriate error message.

item.name: Add rating with Invalid Rating Value

exec: pm.test("Error message for invalid rating", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /ratings endpoint with an invalid rating value (e.g., a value out of the accepted range). The test ensures the API returns a 400 status code with a validation error.

exec: pm.test("Error message for non-existent book ID", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /ratings endpoint by providing a non-existent book ID. The test checks that the API responds with a 404 status code.

exec: pm.test("Error message for invalid rating ID", function () {

request.description: Tests the GET /ratings/{id} endpoint with an invalid or non-existent rating ID. The test ensures the API returns a 404 status code indicating that the rating was not found.

exec: pm.test("Error message for invalid rating ID", function () {

request.description: Tests the DELETE /ratings/{id} endpoint with an invalid rating ID. The test verifies that the API returns a 404 status code indicating that the rating was not found.

item.description: This collection tests the Ratings-related endpoints, including creating, retrieving, updating, and deleting ratings associated with books.

item.name: Notes

request.description: Tests the POST /notes endpoint to create a new note for a book. The test verifies that the note is successfully created and the correct status code (201) is returned.

exec: pm.test("Response contains valid note data", function () {

request.description: Tests the GET /notes/{id} endpoint to retrieve a specific note by its ID. The test ensures that the correct note data is returned with a 200 status code.
Tests the DELETE /notes/{id} endpoint to delete a note by its ID. The test confirms that the note is deleted successfully and returns a 200 status code.

exec: pm.test("Error message for missing notes_text", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /notes endpoint by sending a request with missing required fields (e.g., empty note text). The test ensures that the API returns a 400 status code indicating missing data.

exec: pm.test("Error message for empty notes_text", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /notes endpoint by sending a request with invalid or malformed data. The test checks that the API returns a 400 status code with an appropriate error message.

exec: pm.test("Error message for invalid note ID", function () {

item.description: This collection tests the Notes-related endpoints, including creating, retrieving, and deleting notes for books.

item.name: Favorites

request.description: Tests the POST /favorites endpoint to add a book to the favorites list. The test verifies that the book is added successfully and returns a 201 status code.

exec: pm.test("Response contains correct favorite data", function () {

request.description: Tests the GET /favorites/{id} endpoint to retrieve a favorite book by its ID. The test checks that the correct book is returned with a 200 status code.

exec: pm.test("Response contains updated favorite data", function () {

request.description: Tests the PUT /favorites/{id} endpoint to update a favorite book. The test ensures the favorite is updated correctly and returns a 200 status code.
Tests the DELETE /favorites/{id} endpoint to remove a book from the favorites list by its ID. The test ensures the book is deleted and returns a 204 status code.

item.description: This collection tests the endpoints related to managing the favorite books list, including adding, updating, and deleting books from the favorites list.

item.name: Reading Progress

exec: pm.test("Response contains valid reading progress data", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /reading-progress endpoint to create a new reading progress record. Ensures valid data results in a 201 status code and the progress is recorded.

exec: pm.test("Response contains updated reading progress data", function () {

request.description: Tests the PUT /reading-progress/{id} endpoint to update an existing reading progress record. Confirms a successful update and a 200 status code.

exec: pm.test("Response contains correct reading progress data", function () {

request.description: Tests the GET /reading-progress/{id} endpoint to retrieve progress by its ID. Ensures a 200 status code and correct progress data.
Tests the DELETE /reading-progress/{id} endpoint to delete a reading progress record. Validates that the record is deleted successfully with a 200 status code.

exec: pm.test("Error message for invalid current_page", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /reading-progress endpoint with an invalid current_page value (e.g., negative number or non-integer). Ensures the API returns a 400 status code

exec: pm.test("Error message for current_page greater than total_pages", function () {

request.description: Tests the POST /reading-progress endpoint where current_page exceeds total_pages. Verifies the API rejects the request with a 400 status code.

item.name: Update a reading progress with invalid ID

exec: pm.test("Error message for non-existent ID", function () {

request.description: Tests the PUT /reading-progress/{id} endpoint with an invalid or non-existent ID. Confirms the API responds with a 404 status code and relevant error message.

item.name: Get reading progress with invalid  ID

exec: pm.test("Error message for non-existent ID", function () {

request.description: Tests the GET /reading-progress/{id} endpoint using an invalid or malformed ID. Ensures the API returns a 404 or 400 error for invalid input.

item.name: Delete reading progress with invalid ID

exec: pm.test("Error message for non-existent ID", function () {

request.description: Tests the DELETE /reading-progress/{id} endpoint using an invalid ID. Confirms that the API returns a 404 status code indicating the record was not found.

item.description: This collection tests the API endpoints for managing reading progress of books. It covers creating, updating, retrieving, and deleting reading progress records, as well as handling invalid input scenarios.
